description: A Harvard Poetry Professor Reviewed Haiku I Got Sent on Tinder
extended: "In this 4:20 haiku, the poet establishes his relaxed nature right away, in that smooth 'what's up,' but he balances the chill tonality with a super-specific image: He invites Julia to smoke a joint and watch the rain.

description: Gothamist Guide To January: 20 Ways To Light Up 2016: Gothamist

extended: Lara Logan thought she was going to die in Tahrir Square when she was sexually assaulted by a mob on the night that Hosni Mubarak’s government fell in Cairo. Ms. Logan, a CBS News correspondent, was in the square preparing a report for “60 Minutes” on Feb.

description: Nightclub bouncer wears GoPro to show the terrors of working NYE
extended: Going out on New Year's Eve is like braving the wild frontier: everyone must fend for themselves, and you will probably end up dirty.

description: How Stoya took on James Deen and broke the porn industry's silence | Culture | The Guardian
extended: Stoya says she couldn’t sleep. After arriving in Serbia on 18 November to begin work on a film, she had been woken by nightmares.

description: Ian Brady and Myra Hindley - Criminal Minds Wiki - Wikia
extended: Ian Brady and Myra Hindley, a.k.a. "The Moors Murderers", were a young couple who killed five people, three of them children, together in the 1960s. Brady was born Ian Duncan Stewart in Glasgow, Scotland. His mother was Maggie Stewart, a 28-year-old tearoom waitress.

description: Beyond Zero and One: Machines, Psychedelics, and Consciousness by Andrew Smart review – inside the minds of computers | Books | The Guardian
extended: Do androids dream of electric Kool-Aid acid tests? If there’s to be any hope for us, they will. That is the message of Andrew Smart’s splendidly mind-bending book, which mashes up Alan Turing, The Matrix, Immanuel Kant, “zombie AI”, Leibniz, and research on psychedelic drugs.

description: Everything You Know About Martin Shkreli Is Wrong—or Is It? | Vanity Fair
extended: “I don’t mean to be presumptuous, but I liken myself to the robber barons.” So says Martin Shkreli, the 32-year-old hedge-fund manager turned pharmaceutical-company C.E.O., who achieved instantaneous notoriety last fall when he acquired the U.S.

description: AJ+ - Syrian Town Starving to Death | Facebook
Kevin Hart, Ice Cube are the most distracting driver's ed teachers
extended: Conan O'Brien, Kevin Hart and Ice Cube have taken it upon themselves to teach Conan staffer Diana Chang how to drive — so everyone on the road better watch out. From fire trucks to lane changes to road rage, these unlikely passengers are full of unorthodox advice.

description: My Wedding Night Was Interrupted by a Coke-Fueled Orgy in My Apartment | VICE | United States
extended: My husband and I began using Airbnb in March of 2015. Our first guest was an older man from Halifax, who was in town visiting his dying friend. He shared our passion for cinema, and he would visit us two more times over the next year.

description: The newest important person in newsrooms: audience-development czars - Digiday
extended: The New York Times’ Innovation Report pointed out the need for audience-development specialists to get Times content in front of more readers. While the Times called for a new, cross-departmental approach to this function, other news outlets have already been putting more muscle behind the role.
